intro: Chlamysperma polygama, commonly known as the silverleaf goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and bright yellow inflorescences that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, often found in prairies and open woodlands. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for native plant gardens.
